translation.en: [woman] This is my diary.
translation.ja: これは私の日記

translation.en: I'm reading you the excerpt from December 12, 1978.
translation.ja: 1978年12月12日の抜粋を読み上げるわ

translation.en: So, it says, "Today was an absolute miserable day."
translation.ja: “今日は最悪だった”

translation.en: "Rob never came home last night." "He never got back to the store, and he never went home."
translation.ja: “昨晩 ロブは店にも家にも戻ってこなかった”

translation.en: [woman] When I was about 15, I started working at Nisson Pharmacy.
translation.ja: 15歳の時 ニソン薬局でアルバイトをした

translation.en: I was a clerk. I was the person at the front and ran the cash register.
translation.ja: 私は店の入り口近くでレジを担当した 私は店の入り口近くでレジを担当した キム･バイアース博士ロブ･ピーストの友人

translation.en: I met Rob Piest when he came to work at the pharmacy. He was the new stock boy.
translation.ja: ロブは新人で 薬局の在庫担当として働き始めた

translation.en: He did sports.
translation.ja: 彼は運動が好き

translation.en: He was a gymnast.
translation.ja: 体操選手だった

translation.en: And he had outdoor interests, um, in hiking,
translation.ja: アウトドア派の彼は ハイキングと写真撮影が好きだった

translation.en: and he was a photographer.
translation.ja: ハイキングと写真撮影が好きだった

translation.en: He was actually working there to save money for a camera and a car.
translation.ja: カメラと車を買うためにバイトをしていた

translation.en: He was very close with his family. He loved his family and he talked about 'em a lot.
translation.ja: 家族と仲がよくよく家族の話をした

translation.en: I remember when I came to work on December 11.
translation.ja: 12月11日のことは覚えている

translation.en: In December in Chicago, it is freezing.
translation.ja: 12月のシカゴは寒い

translation.en: And the cash register was right at the front of the door,
translation.ja: レジはドアの正面にあり

translation.en: and people were in and out a lot, and I would get cold.
translation.ja: 人が出入りするから寒かった

translation.en: And so, Rob had a very nice, uh, blue down jacket.
translation.ja: ロブは とてもいい青いダウンコートを 持っていた

translation.en: So I asked him if I could borrow it and wear it at the front while I was working the cash register.
translation.ja: だから彼に レジで働く間貸してと頼んだ

translation.en: There was a man, a middle-aged man in, you know, a flannel shirt walking around the store.
translation.ja: フランネルのシャツを着た中年男性が店を歩いていた

translation.en: I asked the pharmacist and he said, oh, he was a contractor
translation.ja: 彼は業者の人で店の改装計画の件で来たと

translation.en: who was there because they were thinking about doing some remodeling in the store.
translation.ja: 彼は業者の人で店の改装計画の件で来たと 薬剤師が私に言った

translation.en: As the night was winding down,
translation.ja: 夜になるとロブがレジに来て

translation.en: Rob came back to the front of the counter
translation.ja: 夜になるとロブがレジに来て “外で業者と仕事の話をするから”

translation.en: and said, "Hey, can I have my jacket back?"
translation.ja: “外で業者と仕事の話をするから”

translation.en: "I'm gonna go outside and talk to that contractor about a job."
translation.ja: “コートを返して”と言った

translation.en: And then he put his jacket on and he went outside.
translation.ja: 彼はコートを着て外に出た

translation.en: [Byers-Lund] And then, you know, the store stayed busy.
translation.ja: その後 店は忙しく

translation.en: So I kind of lost track of time and the fact that, you know, we were getting ready to close.
translation.ja: 気が付くと閉店の準備をする時間だった

translation.en: And his mom came in and wanted to know where he was.
translation.ja: ロブの母親が来て彼の居場所を聞いた

translation.en: And I asked her, I said, "He's outside talking to some contractor about a job."
translation.ja: “外で業者と話しているはず”と答えたら

translation.en: And she said, no, he… she didn't see him out there.
translation.ja: “外にはいない”と言った

translation.en: So she said, "Tell him just call me when he gets back,
translation.ja: “迎えに来るから電話して”と

translation.en: and I will come over and pick him up."
translation.ja: ロブへの伝言を頼まれた

translation.en: And so, when the final closing was at 10:00,
translation.ja: 10時の閉店時間に 彼女が電話でロブは戻ったか聞いた

translation.en: um, his mom had called and said, "Is he back yet?"
translation.ja: 彼女が電話でロブは戻ったか聞いた

translation.en: And I said, "No. He's not here at all."
translation.ja: “いない”と私は答えた

translation.en: I knew that that night was Rob's mom's birthday. That's why she waited for a while,
translation.ja: その夜 ロブの母親の誕生日会があったので

translation.en: 'cause they had a birthday celebration planned for that night.
translation.ja: 彼女は しばらく待った

translation.en: Rob would never have missed his mom's birthday. He was missing.
translation.ja: 彼は母親の誕生日を忘れない失踪したのよ

translation.en: [Gacy] First of all, drop that "Mr. Gacy" thing.
translation.ja: “ゲイシーさん”は やめろ

translation.en: [investigator] Okay, John. That was technical.
translation.ja: 分かった　形式的なものよ

translation.en: [Gacy] I don't know who the hell you're talking to. Just John.
translation.ja: 誰か分からない“ジョン”でいい

translation.en: [investigator] Okay, John. Go ahead.
translation.ja: ジョン どうぞ

translation.en: [Gacy] John, or JW, or whatever the hell else they call me, or whatever else comes to your mind if I get too mad.
translation.ja: ジョンでも“ＪＷ”でも思いついた名でいい

translation.en: [Gacy] Nobody wants to accept what the hell I say.
translation.ja: 誰も私の発言に納得しない

translation.en: Because what I tell you is… is what I know as fact.
translation.ja: 私が話すことは事実だ

translation.en: I have nothing to gain.
translation.ja: ウソを話しても

translation.en: I have nothing to lose by telling you something that's not the truth.
translation.ja: 私が得をすることは何もない

translation.en: But I'm getting to the point that I keep going over and over and over every fucking thing.
translation.ja: でも全てのことを何度も話さないといけない

translation.en: But I'm at the breaking point with it.
translation.ja: もう限界だ

translation.en: I don't… I don't know how much more of this shit I can take.
translation.ja: いつまで耐えられるか分からない

translation.en: -[investigator] What do you think happen-- -[Gacy] I don't know. I… I don't.
translation.ja: 何があったと… 知らない　分からない

translation.en: [man] 1978. I had just left the Public Defender's Office.
translation.ja: 1978年に国選弁護人をやめて

translation.en: I decided to go into private practice.
translation.ja: 独立することにした 独立することにした サム･アミランテゲイシーの刑事弁護士

translation.en: Sitting in my new office and, uh, I get a telephone call.
translation.ja: サム･アミランテゲイシーの刑事弁護士 新しい事務所に電話がかかってきた 新しい事務所に電話がかかってきた

translation.en: [Amirante] I said, "Law office." He said, "Hi, Sam. This is John Gacy."
translation.ja: 電話を取るとジョン･ゲイシーからだった

translation.en: I said, "Hi, John, how are you?" He said, "Can you do me a favor?"
translation.ja: 電話を取るとジョン･ゲイシーからだった デス･プレーンズ警察が彼を尾行する理由を

translation.en: I said, "Sure. What do you need?"
translation.ja: デス･プレーンズ警察が彼を尾行する理由を

translation.en: "Find out why I'm being tailed by the Des Plaines police." "No problem."
translation.ja: デス･プレーンズ警察が彼を尾行する理由を 調べてほしいと言われ引き受けた

translation.en: [Sam] I had been Chief Public Defender in Des Plaines, where this was going on.
translation.ja: 〝デス･プレーンズ〞 デス･プレーンズの国選弁護人団長だったので デス･プレーンズの国選弁護人団長だったので

translation.en: I knew all those guys over there. I know the chief, I know the mayor.
translation.ja: 私は市長や各組織の長を知っていた

translation.en: I'll… I'll find out. I'll ask some questions, I'll ask around.
translation.ja: だから彼らに聞こうと思った

translation.en: And so, my first client in my private practice was John Gacy.
translation.ja: 独立後の最初の依頼人はゲイシーだった

translation.en: You know, everybody from the neighborhood,
translation.ja: シカゴ郊外の北西地域で

translation.en: from the northwest suburbs of Chicago knew John Gacy.
translation.ja: ジョン･ゲイシーは有名だった

translation.en: He had a construction business called Painting, Decorating and Maintenance.
translation.ja: 彼はＰＤＭという建設会社を持っていた

translation.en: He was also a Democratic Precinct Captain in the Cook County Democratic Organization.
translation.ja: 彼はクック郡の民主党選挙区幹事も務めていた

translation.en: Precinct Captains take care of the people in the neighborhood.
translation.ja: 幹事は地域の人々の面倒を見る

translation.en: So if somebody needed a garbage can, or somebody needed a bulb changed,
translation.ja: ゴミ箱の設置や電球交換私道の雪かきなど

translation.en: or somebody needed their driveway shoveled, or something,
translation.ja: ゴミ箱の設置や電球交換私道の雪かきなど 助けが必要な人がいたら幹事が手伝う

translation.en: the Precinct Captain would be there to help them.
translation.ja: 助けが必要な人がいたら幹事が手伝う

translation.en: Gacy was the best Precinct Captain
translation.ja: 彼はノーウッドパーク民主党団体で

translation.en: in the Norwood Park Democratic Organization.
translation.ja: 彼はノーウッドパーク民主党団体で 一番の幹事だった

translation.en: Everybody knew him.
translation.ja: 有名だった

translation.en: I got active in the Democratic Party because I wanted to get into politics someday.
translation.ja: 政界進出を狙い民主党を手伝っていた私は

translation.en: And so, I knew him through doing that.
translation.ja: 彼とそこで知り合った

translation.en: He called me because he thought I had influence.
translation.ja: 弁護士の腕ではなく私の影響力を当てにして

translation.en: Not because he thought I was a great lawyer. He thought I had clout.
translation.ja: 弁護士の腕ではなく私の影響力を当てにして 彼は私に電話した

translation.en: So the first thing I did was go to the police.
translation.ja: 私は警察に行き“ゲイシーは いい男だ”

translation.en: "Hey, John Gacy's a good guy. What are you guys following him for?"
translation.ja: 私は警察に行き“ゲイシーは いい男だ” “何の捜査？”と聞いた

translation.en: They'd say, "There's a missing kid. We think he has something to do with it."
translation.ja: “失踪した少年と彼は関係がある”と言うので

translation.en: I'd be like, "You're crazy, a missing kid. You obviously have the wrong guy."
translation.ja: “失踪した少年と彼は関係がある”と言うので “ありえない”と言った

translation.en: [man 1] I was assigned to the Piest case the day after he disappeared.
translation.ja: １９７８年12月12日失踪の翌日 ロブ･ピーストの担当になった 失踪の翌日 ロブ･ピーストの担当になった

translation.en: Rob Piest had a part-time job at Nisson Drugs.
translation.ja: ロブはニソン薬局でアルバイトをしていた ロブはニソン薬局でアルバイトをしていた ラファエル･トーヴァーデス･プレーンズ警察

translation.en: It was on Touhy Avenue in Des Plaines.
translation.ja: ロブはニソン薬局でアルバイトをしていた ラファエル･トーヴァーデス･プレーンズ警察

translation.en: A missing persons report was filed by the Piest family.
translation.ja: 〝失踪届ロブ･ピースト〞 彼の家族が失踪届を出した 彼の家族が失踪届を出した 彼の家族が失踪届を出した 〝デス･プレーンズ１９７８年12月11日〞

translation.en: They were in shock, I believe,
translation.ja: 〝デス･プレーンズ１９７８年12月11日〞 若い男性の失踪は珍しくショックを受けていた 若い男性の失踪は珍しくショックを受けていた

translation.en: because this is just so unlike the young man to disappear.
translation.ja: 若い男性の失踪は珍しくショックを受けていた

translation.en: When Mr. and Mrs. Piest came into the office,
translation.ja: 事務所に来たピースト夫妻は 事務所に来たピースト夫妻は テリー･サリバンクック郡 検事

translation.en: uh, they were… uh, distraught, completely.
translation.ja: テリー･サリバンクック郡 検事 テリー･サリバンクック郡 検事 完全に取り乱していた 完全に取り乱していた

translation.en: They had been out all night searching for Rob.
translation.ja: 〝行方不明の若者〞夫妻は夜じゅう外で息子を捜した

translation.en: We talked, and they convinced me in about a minute,
translation.ja: 話を聞いてすぐに夫妻が言うとおり

translation.en: that, in fact, uh, we had something more than a runaway on our hands.
translation.ja: 家出ではないと確信を得た

translation.en: And that's really what led our office, that is the prosecutor's office,
translation.ja: その結果 私たち検察局が この事件に関わることになった

translation.en: uh, to become involved in the case.
translation.ja: この事件に関わることになった

translation.en: [man 2] Rob Piest was a great all-American kid, 15 years old.
translation.ja: 15歳のロブは理想的なアメリカの子だった

translation.en: Come from a very stable family, well-liked by everybody,
translation.ja: よい家族を持ち皆に好かれていた

translation.en: didn't have any girlfriend problems or any other issues.
translation.ja: 恋人との問題もなかった

translation.en: And he had a… a brother and a sister.
translation.ja: 彼には兄弟がいた 彼には兄弟がいた マイケル･アルブレクトデス･プレーンズ警察

translation.en: Uh, he was the youngest.
translation.ja: マイケル･アルブレクトデス･プレーンズ警察 彼は末っ子で家族全員と仲がよかった

translation.en: And everybody got along well with that family.
translation.ja: マイケル･アルブレクトデス･プレーンズ警察 彼は末っ子で家族全員と仲がよかった 彼は末っ子で家族全員と仲がよかった

translation.en: [Tovar] The officer that filed the missing persons report
translation.ja: 〝ファミリードラッグセンター〞 〝ファミリードラッグセンター〞 失踪届を受けた警官は薬局へ向かった

translation.en: went back to the drug store and asked who had been there that night
translation.ja: 〝ファミリードラッグセンター〞 失踪届を受けた警官は薬局へ向かった そして失踪の夜に薬局にいた人の名前を 〝処方せん〞

translation.en: and incorporated all those names of the people that had been there.
translation.ja: そして失踪の夜に薬局にいた人の名前を 〝処方せん〞 聞き出した

translation.en: Among them was John Wayne Gacy's name.
translation.ja: ゲイシーの名もあった

translation.en: He was there to, uh, get an estimate
translation.ja: 彼は薬局の改装にいくらかかるか 〝ＰＤＭ建設のジョン･ゲイシー〞

translation.en: for a job he wanted to do there at the drugstore.
translation.ja: 彼は薬局の改装にいくらかかるか 〝ＰＤＭ建設のジョン･ゲイシー〞 〝ＰＤＭ建設のジョン･ゲイシー〞 〝ＰＤＭ建設のジョン･ゲイシー〞 見積もりに来ていた

translation.en: One of the first things we always do, we see who we're dealing with.
translation.ja: 〝塗装(Ｐ) 装飾(Ｄ)メンテナンス(Ｍ)〞まず薬局にいた人たちを知るため

translation.en: So we started running the names, checking them for criminal histories.
translation.ja: 〝塗装(Ｐ) 装飾(Ｄ)メンテナンス(Ｍ)〞まず薬局にいた人たちを知るため 〝塗装(Ｐ) 装飾(Ｄ)メンテナンス(Ｍ)〞 〝塗装(Ｐ) 装飾(Ｄ)メンテナンス(Ｍ)〞彼らの犯罪歴を調べた 彼らの犯罪歴を調べた 彼らの犯罪歴を調べた〝ジョン･ゲイシー〞

translation.en: I think the next-to-last name I checked was Gacy's name.
translation.ja: 最後から２番目がゲイシー

translation.en: And we immediately got a hit on him, that he had done time in Iowa for sodomy.
translation.ja: 〝ジョン･ウェイン･ゲイシー〞 〝ジョン･ウェイン･ゲイシー〞 彼はアイオワ州で 〝ジョン･ウェイン･ゲイシー〞 〝ジョン･ウェイン･ゲイシー〞 不自然性交罪(ソドミー)で逮捕されていた 不自然性交罪(ソドミー)で逮捕されていた 不自然性交罪(ソドミー)で逮捕されていた 〝アイオワ州ウォータールー〞

translation.en: So immediately, that put him at the head of the line
translation.ja: 〝ソドミー罪〞 その事実から すぐに彼は その事実から すぐに彼は

translation.en: as far as possible persons of interest.
translation.ja: 最重要参考人の１人となった

translation.en: John Wayne Gacy lived in Norwood Park Township.
translation.ja: 彼はノーウッドパークに住んでいた

translation.en: It's a Chicago address,
translation.ja: 住所はシカゴだが 住所はシカゴだが〝ノーウッドパークゲイシーの家〞

translation.en: but it's an unincorporated area of Cook County.
translation.ja: 〝ノーウッドパークゲイシーの家〞 〝ノーウッドパークゲイシーの家〞自治体に属さないクック郡にある

translation.en: [Albrecht] Joseph Kozenczak was Head of Investigations
translation.ja: 捜査を率いるデス･プレーンズ警察の

translation.en: of the Des Plaines Police Department.
translation.ja: 捜査を率いるデス･プレーンズ警察の コゼンザックがゲイシーと話した

translation.en: He went out to talk to John Gacy.
translation.ja: コゼンザックがゲイシーと話した

translation.en: [Gacy] Lieutenant Kozenczak, the asshole from Des Plaines Police Department,
translation.ja: デス･プレーンズのコゼンザックに

translation.en: talked to me about the Piest boy disappearance, asked me if I'd come down and give a witness statement.
translation.ja: ピースト失踪事件の証言を署でしてくれと頼まれた

translation.en: I told him I didn't have time, that I'd just had a death in the family,
translation.ja: 身内が亡くなり母から電話を待っているから

translation.en: that I'm waiting for a call from my mother in Arkansas.
translation.ja: 身内が亡くなり母から電話を待っているから 時間がないと断った

translation.en: So he told Kozenczak he had to take care of his family things,
translation.ja: ゲイシーは断ったが

translation.en: and Kozenczak told him it would just be a while, just come out.
translation.ja: コゼンザックはすぐに終わると粘った

translation.en: He got very aggravated about that. He said, "You know, Kozenczak has no respect for the dead."
translation.ja: ゲイシーは 死者に敬意を払えと腹を立てた

translation.en: [Gacy] I said, "You're very rude at the time of death."
translation.ja: “死者に失礼だ”と言った

translation.en: And I just told him, you know, "When I got time, I'd get down there."
translation.ja: “後で時間がある時に協力する”

translation.en: I said, "I'll come down later." "How much later?" "I don't know. When I get down there, I'll be down there."
translation.ja: “いつか分からないが行った時に証言する”

translation.en: [Tovar] One detective was assigned to watch the house.
translation.ja: １人の刑事が家の監視をしていた

translation.en: They had seen Gacy arrive in his van.
translation.ja: ゲイシーがバンで帰宅して 〝ＰＤＭ 建設業者〞 〝ＰＤＭ 建設業者〞 〝ＰＤＭ 建設業者〞 再びバンが出発したので刑事は後をつけた

translation.en: Well, when the van left, they followed the van,
translation.ja: 再びバンが出発したので刑事は後をつけた

translation.en: thinking that Gacy was in it,
translation.ja: だが運転していたのは

translation.en: when, in fact, it was one of his workers that took the van.
translation.ja: ゲイシーではなく彼の従業員だった

translation.en: When they finally caught up to it, they realized it wasn't Gacy. By that time, Gacy was gone.
translation.ja: そのことに気付いた時にはゲイシーは消えていた

translation.en: [man 3] When Gacy did come into the police station, he comes in at 3:00 in the morning, everybody's gone.
translation.ja: 誰もいない午前３時にゲイシーが警察署に来た

translation.en: He's covered with mud. His pants are full of mud.
translation.ja: 彼のズボンも靴も泥だらけだった 彼のズボンも靴も泥だらけだった グレッグ･ベドークック郡 捜査官

translation.en: His, you know, his shoes are all full of mud.
translation.ja: 彼のズボンも靴も泥だらけだった グレッグ･ベドークック郡 捜査官

translation.en: His car with the back bumper was packed with mud.
translation.ja: 車の後ろのバンパーも泥まみれ

translation.en: There was mud up to the axles. He had mud all over the floorboard.
translation.ja: 車軸や車内の床まで泥が入っていた

translation.en: Uh, and there was nobody there to talk to him. So he left.
translation.ja: 署に誰もいないので彼は去った

translation.en: [Gacy] I drove over to the Des Plaines police station because I knew they were waiting for me.
translation.ja: デス･プレーンズ警察署へ行った

translation.en: [investigator] Who'd you see?
translation.ja: 誰に会った？

translation.en: [Gacy] I said, "I'm here to see Lt. Kozenczak." He says, "Oh, he left hours ago."
translation.ja: コゼンザック警部補に会いに行ったが不在で

translation.en: I says, "Well, okay, tell him I'll be back in the morning."

translation.ja: 当時 私もリロイもゲイシーは無罪だと信じた

translation.en: which was a sodomy case, which, you know, I was shocked that he had that
translation.ja: ソドミー罪で逮捕されたと聞き驚いた 選挙区幹事が性犯罪で有罪になったとは

translation.en: 'cause no… who expected Gacy, this guy who was the precinct captain,
translation.ja: 選挙区幹事が性犯罪で有罪になったとは

translation.en: to have been convicted of sodomy? Nobody knew that.
translation.ja: 選挙区幹事が性犯罪で有罪になったとは 誰も知らなかった

translation.ja: 私はフォート･マディソンの刑務所に行くはずだったが

translation.en: that since I was a first offender and I was still under 26,
translation.ja: 初犯で26歳以下だったので

translation.en: that I should be sent to the men's reformatory at Anamosa.
translation.ja: アナモサの矯正施設に送られた

translation.en: I was sent there. I was scared to death.
translation.ja: 死ぬほど怖かった

translation.en: Again, never being arrested before, never being in jail before, didn't know what the hell…
translation.ja: 逮捕されるのも刑務所に入るのも初めてで

translation.en: I thought I was gonna get killed in there.

translation.en: ♪ O come let us adore him ♪
translation.ja: アナモサのクリスマス

translation.en: ♪ O come let us adore him ♪
translation.ja: 1969年 特別ニュースＷＨＯテレビ デモイン

translation.en: …I got into it and organized myself.
translation.ja: 私は施設になじみうまくやっていった

translation.en: I went in there with a positive attitude.
translation.ja: 前向きになれた

translation.en: And, uh, I became not only popular, but powerful.
translation.ja: 私は人気者になり権力を得ていった

translation.ja: 私はアイオワ州出身のジョン･ゲイシー

translation.en: [man 7] And you're a man of some authority here. What's your title?

translation.en: and I run the, uh, the morning meal and the afternoon meal in the kitchen.
translation.ja: 皆に午前と午後の食事をキッチンで用意する

translation.en: Food was a… was an avenue of power
translation.ja: “食事”は施設で権力を握るための近道だった “食事”は施設で権力を握るための近道だった レイ･コーネル元服役囚アナモサ矯正施設

translation.en: is… is I guess that's how I would describe it,
translation.ja: “食事”は施設で権力を握るための近道だった レイ･コーネル元服役囚アナモサ矯正施設 レイ･コーネル元服役囚アナモサ矯正施設

translation.en: would be an avenue of power.
translation.ja: レイ･コーネル元服役囚アナモサ矯正施設 権力を得るための道

translation.en: And John used it relentlessly.
translation.ja: ジョンはそれを容赦なく使った

translation.en: Screw with John Gacy
translation.ja: ゲイシーの悪口を言ったら

translation.en: and you better start taking your meals somewhere else
translation.ja: ゲイシーの悪口を言ったら 別の所で食事を取ったほうがいい

translation.en: because you had to assume that you're gonna get something like,
translation.ja: なぜなら次の自分の食事に ネズミのフンなどがきっと入っているからだ

translation.en: for lack of a better description,
translation.ja: ネズミのフンなどがきっと入っているからだ

translation.en: mouse turds in your… in your food the next time you come through
translation.ja: ネズミのフンなどがきっと入っているからだ 彼に逆らうと そうなる

translation.en: because you didn't do what he said.
translation.ja: 彼に逆らうと そうなる

translation.en: [Gacy] Without force, I controlled the kitchen,
translation.ja: 力を使わずに 55人の囚人が働くキッチンを支配した

translation.en: and there was some 55 inmates in the kitchen.
translation.ja: 55人の囚人が働くキッチンを支配した

translation.en: But I never yield to anybody.
translation.ja: 私は誰にも従わなかった

translation.en: [Cornell] The other thing, of course, was the… the Jaycees, and that's how I met him.
translation.ja: もう１つは青年会議所だ私は彼にそこで会った

translation.en: I'm sitting there reading or something,
translation.ja: 座って読書をしていたら

translation.en: and he said, "Hi, I'm John Gacy, and, uh, I'm recruiting for the Jaycees."
translation.ja: “私はゲイシー” “青年会議所の会員を募集中だ”と言われた

translation.en: I didn't even know what the hell the Jaycees was at that point.
translation.ja: 青年会議所が何か知らなかった

translation.en: By halfway through the time that we were there,
translation.ja: 〝ロン･ピルチャー会長矯正施設 青年会議所〞しかし施設での生活が半分を過ぎたころだった しかし施設での生活が半分を過ぎたころだった しかし施設での生活が半分を過ぎたころだった〝アメリカを誇れ〞

translation.en: say toward the end of 1969,
translation.ja: しかし施設での生活が半分を過ぎたころだった 1969年末ごろに

translation.en: that was one of the largest Jaycee chapters in the entire state of Iowa,
translation.ja: アイオワ州の青年会議所は全盛期を迎えた

translation.en: largely due to the recruiting efforts of John Gacy.
translation.ja: 主な理由はゲイシーが会員を集めたからだ

translation.en: …at the Anamosa Men's Reformatory.
translation.ja: 最優秀賞を受賞した

translation.en: I built the first miniature golf course inside the walls of a reformatory.
translation.ja: 私は施設初のミニゴルフを作った

translation.en: [Cornell] This is an example of the man's abilities and talent.
translation.ja: これは彼の能力と才能の一例だと思う

translation.en: I think you could make a case that there was a good John and a bad John.
translation.ja: いいジョンと悪いジョンがいて

translation.en: I knew the good John.
translation.ja: 私は前者を知っていた

translation.en: I had glimpses of other things.
translation.ja: 彼の他の側面も見た

translation.en: [Gacy] The weak do not survive in prison.
translation.ja: 弱者は刑務所で生きられない

translation.en: You either come under, uh, the ruling of… of some gang or… or some other forceful inmate.
translation.ja: ギャングか強い囚人の支配下に入るしかない

translation.en: You do what he says, otherwise you get the shit kicked out of you.
translation.ja: そして彼らの言うとおりにする

translation.en: Well, I would not bow to any of that shit
translation.ja: 私は誰にも従わない

translation.en: because nobody will ever lead me.
translation.ja: 誰も私を従えられない

translation.en: He was walking on the range that he lived in, over in the south house,
translation.ja: 彼が自分の住む施設の南棟を歩いていると

translation.en: and he saw one inmate performing fellatio on another inmate in a cell,
translation.ja: ある服役囚が別の服役囚に 独房でフェラチオをしていた

translation.en: and just simply walked over, and kicked the guy in the face four times,
translation.ja: ジョンは男に近づき顔を４回蹴り 相手のあごを折った

translation.en: and basically broke his jaw.
translation.ja: 相手のあごを折った

translation.en: He's struggling with his sexual urges toward homosexuals.
translation.ja: 彼は同性愛に対する性的衝動に苦しんでいた

translation.en: That came out in his, in my opinion…
translation.ja: その苦しみが彼の場合

translation.en: That came out in his personality as anger, as rage.
translation.ja: 怒りや憤りとして現れていたと私は思う

translation.en: [man 7] How long have you been here?
translation.ja: いつから施設に？

translation.en: I've been here now a year and about two weeks.
translation.ja: 約１年と２週間 ここにいる

translation.en: [man 7] You mind my asking how long do you plan to take up residence here?
translation.ja: ここにいつまでいるつもり？

translation.en: Well, I hope to be getting out sometime in May.
translation.ja: ５月には出たいと思っている

translation.en: [man 7] Well, good. Yes. You gonna continue as a cook, use that as a profession, do you think?
translation.ja: そうか　出てからもコックとして働く予定？

translation.en: Right. This is my profession before I came in.
translation.ja: ええ 元はコックだった

translation.en: -[man 7] All right. -Food service.
translation.ja: そう 飲食業だ

translation.en: [Cornell] It was Christmastime.
translation.ja: 〝トイズ･フォー･トッツ〞クリスマスの時期に

translation.en: We were deeply involved in the Toys for Tots project.
translation.ja: 〝トイズ･フォー･トッツ〞トイズ･フォー･トッツの活動に参加した トイズ･フォー･トッツの活動に参加した

translation.en: We were deeply involved with the Christmas banquet for the Jaycees.
translation.ja: 青年会議所のクリスマスパーティーも手伝った

translation.en: A lot was going on.
translation.ja: 忙しかった

translation.en: But then, John's… [clears throat] …John's father died.
translation.ja: しかしジョンの父親が亡くなった

translation.en: [Gacy] December 18th, my dad went in the hospital in Chicago and I was never told of it.
translation.ja: 12月18日に父が入院したのを知らなかった

translation.en: My dad died December 25th, Christmas Day.
translation.ja: 父は12月25日のクリスマスに死んだ

translation.en: They didn't tell me until after my dad was buried that he died.
translation.ja: 埋葬まで知らされなかった

translation.en: Even after going to the joint for… for this sodomy conviction and all that,
translation.ja: ソドミー罪で刑務所に入ったが 彼の父は存命だった

translation.en: his father was still alive.
translation.ja: 彼の父は存命だった

translation.en: John had the option at some point in time of trying to mend that fence.
translation.ja: いつの日か父と和解するチャンスが彼にはあった

translation.en: But not after that. It was over. It was done.
translation.ja: しかし それはできなくなった

translation.en: I don't recall ever hearing him laugh very much after that.
translation.ja: それ以降彼は笑わなくなった

translation.en: [Gacy] What I'm doing is just telling what my dad always told me, is I'm weak.
translation.ja: 父がよく言ったとおり私は弱い

translation.en: Just a dumb, stupid kid. Can't do nothing.
translation.ja: ただのバカな子供で何もできない

translation.en: Yeah, he was right about a lot of things. I let him down when he died.
translation.ja: 彼は正しかった失望させて死なせた

translation.en: [Cornell] Most of the people who were serving ten-year sentences
translation.ja: 懲役10年の刑を受けた者の大半が

translation.en: would serve around two years.
translation.ja: ２年間 服役する

translation.en: But because of who we were and what we did inside,
translation.ja: だが私とジョンは施設での活動が認められ

translation.en: John and I got out in 18 months.
translation.ja: だが私とジョンは施設での活動が認められ 18カ月で出所した

translation.en: So he and I basically left, uh, that, uh, second week in July,
translation.ja: 私たちは７月の２週目に施設を後にした

translation.en: and, uh, we shook hands and walked away.
translation.ja: お互い握手をして別れた

translation.en: [Robinson] By being with John everywhere all the time,
translation.ja: ジョンを精神的に参らせるために ジョンを精神的に参らせるために１９７８年12月19日

translation.en: we were trying to break him down.
translation.ja: １９７８年12月19日 １９７８年12月19日常に尾行した 常に尾行した

translation.en: I mean, I think that you can be the most law-abiding citizen in the entire world
translation.ja: 法を完璧に守る世界一模範的な市民でも

translation.en: and you still would not want the police to be following you
translation.ja: 毎日24時間 ずっと警察に

translation.en: 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
translation.ja: 尾行されるのは嫌だろう

translation.en: [Albrecht] As it went along
translation.ja: 捜査官はゲイシーの友人や

translation.en: and the investigators were interviewing Gacy contacts, Gacy's friends,
translation.ja: 捜査官はゲイシーの友人や 彼と接触した人たちに話を聞いた

translation.en: I think some friends started realizing there's something more to this.
translation.ja: 彼らは何かあると気付きゲイシーを避けた

translation.en: I feel we were all that Gacy had left to talk to.
translation.ja: 彼らは何かあると気付きゲイシーを避けた 彼の話し相手は私たちだけだった

translation.en: Nobody else wanted much to do with him.
translation.ja: 彼の話し相手は私たちだけだった

translation.en: [Robinson] In some ways,
translation.ja: ある意味ジョンは

translation.en: I think John began to think that we were his best friends.
translation.ja: ある意味ジョンは 私たちを親友だと思い始めた

translation.en: We weren't giving him a hard time, only following him.
translation.ja: 尾行だけで迷惑はかけていない

translation.en: [Robinson] Many times, he invited us in, trying to show what a nice guy he was
translation.ja: 自分はいい人間だと示すために

translation.en: and how amiable he was with us, and it got us into the house.
translation.ja: 彼はよく私たちを家に招き入れた

translation.en: We had gotten a request from Lieutenant Kozenczak.
translation.ja: コゼンザック警部補から依頼があった

translation.en: There were a missing TV and a missing radio from a missing person.
translation.ja: 行方不明の人たちのテレビやラジオが紛失していた

translation.en: [Tovar] John Szyc's mother told us
translation.ja: ジョン･ジックの母親は

translation.en: that a little TV that he had in his bedroom was missing from his house.
translation.ja: 息子の寝室にあったテレビがないと言った

translation.en: She described it as a Motorola type TV,
translation.ja: モトローラのテレビだと言っていた

translation.en: and we recalled having seen a TV similar to that
translation.ja: ゲイシーの家を家宅捜索した時に

translation.en: when we went into Gacy's house during the search warrant.
translation.ja: ゲイシーの家を家宅捜索した時に 似たテレビがあった

translation.en: So Bob Schultz said he had to use the restroom,
translation.ja: ボブ･シュルツはトイレを借りたいと言い

translation.en: which would get him into the other part of the house where he could search.
translation.ja: 家の反対側に行き捜すことにした

translation.en: My job became then to keep John entertained
translation.ja: 私はジョンがボブを 捜さないように彼の相手をした

translation.en: so he didn't go looking for Bob.
translation.ja: 捜さないように彼の相手をした

translation.en: Bob looked around, couldn't find the TV.
translation.ja: 捜したがテレビはなかった

translation.en: So he's in the bathroom, flushin' the toilet like a good guy should. [laughs]
translation.ja: だからトイレに行き流した

translation.en: But then, the heat kicked on.
translation.ja: その時 暖房がついた

translation.en: And that made all the difference in the world
translation.ja: これが全てを変えた

translation.en: because Bob was right there by the heating duct, and this came up,
translation.ja: ボブが暖房の管のそばにいると

translation.en: and he got a whiff of that like you wouldn't believe.
translation.ja: 信じられない臭いが立ちこめてきた

translation.en: And right away, he thought, "A putrid odor?" Yes, it was.
translation.ja: すぐに彼は腐敗臭だと気付いた

translation.en: We've been on the job for too long, we've handled too many dead bodies.
translation.ja: 私たちは仕事柄たくさんの死体を扱う

translation.en: If he says that's what it was, you can take it to the bank.
translation.ja: 彼が腐敗臭と言うなら間違いない

translation.en: Schultz recognized an odor that he knew was decomposing flesh.
translation.ja: ボブは肉が分解する臭いだと言った

translation.en: A body, a dead body.
translation.ja: つまり死体だ

translation.en: Anyway, he comes back at the end of his shift and tells me about the smell.
translation.ja: 彼は戻ってくると臭いの話をした

translation.en: Well at the same time, I was hell-bent on trying to find a way
translation.ja: 私はゲイシーを怒らせて

translation.en: to get underneath Gacy's skin
translation.ja: うっかり有罪を示すことを

translation.en: to… to make him lose his temper and slip up and make a mistake.
translation.ja: うっかり有罪を示すことを 言わせる方法を探していた

translation.en: Say something, you know, that would be incriminating.
translation.ja: 言わせる方法を探していた

translation.en: David Cram worked for him, for his company PDM.
translation.ja: ＰＤＭで働いていたデイビッド･クラムに

translation.en: I said, "Let's get Cram back in here for an interview."
translation.ja: ＰＤＭで働いていたデイビッド･クラムに もう一度話を聞くことにした

translation.en: "Drag him back. Let's talk to him some more."
translation.ja: もう一度話を聞くことにした

translation.en: So, I'm talking to Cram, and I said to him,
translation.ja: クラムに聞いた “ゲイシーが激怒したのを見たことがある？”

translation.en: "Did you ever see Gacy completely lose his temper?"
translation.ja: “ゲイシーが激怒したのを見たことがある？”

translation.en: He says, "Yeah." I say, "What… what was the circumstance?"
translation.ja: “ある” “どんな状況で？”

translation.en: He says, "Well, Gacy had me digging in the crawl space."
translation.ja: “ゲイシーに床下を掘れと言われた”

translation.en: And he says, "I changed directions." "Instead of going on a straight line, I went on a diagonal."
translation.ja: “まっすぐと言われたのに私は斜めに掘った”

translation.en: "Gacy came down to check on what I was doing, how I was digging."
translation.ja: “私の様子を見に来たゲイシーは”

translation.en: "He saw a diagonal instead of a straight line, he completely lost his temper."
translation.ja: “斜めに掘っているのを見て激怒した”

translation.en: Swearing, jumping up and down, hollering, screaming,
translation.ja: “ののしり 叫び 跳んで”

translation.en: "Goddamn it, I told you. I want you to dig here, not here."
translation.ja: “掘る場所が違うと言った”

translation.en: And that's what got me thinking, the whole time we were doing this,
translation.ja: それを聞いて思った ずっと行方不明者がどこにいるか捜していた

translation.en: we're trying to figure out where these people went. Where are they?
translation.ja: ずっと行方不明者がどこにいるか捜していた

translation.en: And, you know, in my wildest dreams, I say, "It can't possibly be,"
translation.ja: ありえないと思ったが

translation.en: but then you hear a story, and then you go, "Is it possible that there's somebody down there?"
translation.ja: この話を聞き 床下にいるかもしれないと考えた

translation.en: So I, that… with that, I had, um…
translation.ja: そこでテリー･サリバン検事に

translation.en: my mission was… [laughs]
translation.ja: そこでテリー･サリバン検事に ２度目の捜査令状を取るように頼んだ

translation.en: …was to get Terry Sullivan to give us a second search warrant,
translation.ja: ２度目の捜査令状を取るように頼んだ

translation.en: which is not usual. Two search warrants on the same property.
translation.ja: 同じ敷地に２回捜査令状を出すのは珍しいが

translation.en: That was crazy. Come on. We gotta get this second search warrant.
translation.ja: 同じ敷地に２回捜査令状を出すのは珍しいが 令状が必要だった

translation.en: "We need the second search warrant!" Terry says, "You can't."
translation.ja: テリーは無理だと言ったが

translation.en: I said, "We gotta… Figure it out! You're the lawyer!"
translation.ja: どうにかしろと言った

translation.en: [Sullivan] What we needed during those days was evidence.
translation.ja: 当時は証拠が必要だった

translation.en: We needed to hook the evidence onto Gacy so it wouldn't fall off.
translation.ja: ゲイシーを結び付ける確かな証拠だ

translation.en: [Byers-Lund] "I came home after school to get something to eat before I went shopping."
translation.ja: “学校から家に戻ると警察から電話があり”

translation.en: "The phone rang, they asked me questions about the film slip."
translation.ja: “写真のレシートについて聞かれた”

translation.en: The night that Rob went missing,
translation.ja: ロブが行方不明になった夜

translation.en: I was, um, handing in some film to be processed at the pharmacy.
translation.ja: ロブが行方不明になった夜 〝フィルムコ素早い現像サービス〞 私は薬局で写真を現像に出した

translation.en: And I filled out my envelope,
translation.ja: 封筒に必要事項を書いて

translation.en: and I put it in the pack that was to be picked up.
translation.ja: 封筒に必要事項を書いて 現像依頼ボックスの中に入れた

translation.en: And I tore off the receipt,
translation.ja: 封筒から切り離したレシートを

translation.en: and then I put the receipt in the little trash box
translation.ja: 封筒から切り離したレシートを レジの横の小さなゴミ箱に入れた

translation.en: that was near the side of the cash register.
translation.ja: レジの横の小さなゴミ箱に入れた

translation.en: And then, um, I just kind of stopped.
translation.ja: 止まってレシートを見ると

translation.en: And then, I stared at that receipt, and it stared back at me.
translation.ja: 見つめ返されたのでなぜか それを拾い

translation.en: And for an unknown reason,
translation.ja: 見つめ返されたのでなぜか それを拾い ロブのコートのポケットに入れた

translation.en: I grabbed the receipt and I stuck it in Rob's jacket pocket.
translation.ja: ロブのコートのポケットに入れた

translation.en: [Sullivan] Thank God Kim Byers had put that little receipt
translation.ja: キム･バイアースが レシートをポケットに入れてくれた

translation.en: into her pocket,
translation.ja: レシートをポケットに入れてくれた

translation.en: which turns out to be Rob's coat.
translation.ja: つまりロブのコートに

translation.en: [Byers-Lund] Those are those hunches, or intuitions,
translation.ja: 直感と呼ぶのか

translation.en: whatever you wanna call them. They drive us to do things that we're not sure why we do.
translation.ja: 理由が分からない行動をする時がある

translation.en: I call them "God whispers," where someone guides you to do something.
translation.ja: それを私は 人々を導く“神のささやき”と呼ぶ

translation.en: [Tovar] That receipt wound up in the trash at John Wayne Gacy's house.
translation.ja: レシートはゲイシーの家のゴミに捨てられた

translation.en: And that was our first connection putting Robert in that house.
translation.ja: ロブと家を結び付ける最初の手掛かりだ

translation.en: [Sullivan] We had it sent out to the crime lab
translation.ja: レシートが現像した写真の封筒から

translation.en: to see if they could match it up
translation.ja: レシートが現像した写真の封筒から 切り離されたものか捜査研究所で調べてもらった 切り離されたものか捜査研究所で調べてもらった 〝Ｋ･バイアース〞

translation.en: to the envelope of developed film.
translation.ja: 切り離されたものか捜査研究所で調べてもらった 〝Ｋ･バイアース〞

translation.en: And, in fact, there was a match,
translation.ja: ２つは合致した

translation.en: exactly how it was torn off
translation.ja: 切り離した部分の形や角度が

translation.en: and the different little pieces and angles that were still in there.
translation.ja: そのままの状態で残っていた

translation.en: Wow, it perfectly matched.
translation.ja: 完全に一致した

translation.en: We were, of course, very happy 'cause that looks really good in court.
translation.ja: 法廷で有利な証拠に歓喜した

translation.en: [Bedoe] The receipt for the film from Kim Byers, plus the smell,
translation.ja: 写真のレシートと腐敗臭の件を受けて

translation.en: that was enough for Terry to say okay, and he drew up a second warrant.
translation.ja: テリーが２度目の捜査令状を取り付けた

translation.en: [Robinson] We had a lot of heat on him at this time,
translation.ja: １９７８年12月20日我々からの圧力を

translation.en: and we could tell from John's deportment that he could feel the pressure too.
translation.ja: ジョンが感じているのが態度から分かった

translation.en: [Amirante] The net was kind of closing in on him. The web was closing in on him at the time.
translation.ja: 彼を囲む包囲網が彼を追い詰めていった

translation.en: His cat and mouse game was coming to an end.
translation.ja: イタチごっこの終わりだ

translation.en: [Tovar] I think we started noticing that something was happening to him,
translation.ja: 彼に何か起きていると我々は気付いた

translation.en: which eventually did. He finally just kinda went off the rails a little bit.
translation.ja: ようやく彼がいつもと違う行動をした

translation.en: [Amirante] John Gacy called me, wanted to get together
translation.ja: ゲイシーから電話があり

translation.en: because he told me that he had something new to tell me and Leroy Stevens.
translation.ja: 私とリロイに話したいことがあると言った

translation.en: And I told him, "John, if it's something new, fine." "Otherwise, I don't wanna hear the same old bullshit from you."
translation.ja: 私は新しい情報でないと話を聞かないと言った

translation.en: [Gacy] Rationally and understandably,
translation.ja: 私は論理的に考えて

translation.en: I went over to talk to Sam about the harassment, not of me,
translation.ja: 警察の嫌がらせについてサムに相談しに行った

translation.en: but why they were harassing my employees.
translation.ja: なぜ私の従業員に嫌がらせをする？

translation.en: Why was I defending them?
translation.ja: なぜ私は彼らを守る？

translation.en: Was I afraid they were gonna say something about what I was doing?
translation.ja: 彼らに何か言われるのを恐れたから？

translation.en: He came and told me the same old story, vehemently denying anything to do with this kid.
translation.ja: 今までと同じで彼はロブとの関係を否定した

translation.en: I… I didn't believe him anymore. I really did not believe him.
translation.ja: もう彼を信じなかった

translation.en: I had a picture of Robbie Piest
translation.ja: 〝失踪した少年は男性と会った：証人〞 デイリーハラルド新聞の１面に

translation.en: that was on the front page of the Daily Herald,
translation.ja: 〝失踪した少年は男性と会った：証人〞 デイリーハラルド新聞の１面に 〝失踪した少年は男性と会った：証人〞 〝失踪した少年は男性と会った：証人〞 ロブ･ピーストの写真が載っていた

translation.en: the suburban news daily out there.
translation.ja: 〝失踪した少年は男性と会った：証人〞 ロブ･ピーストの写真が載っていた ロブ･ピーストの写真が載っていた

translation.en: I started pounding on the table. I said… I said, "Look at this, Gacy! Look at this, John!"
translation.ja: 私は机をたたいて言った“見ろ ゲイシー”

translation.en: "This kid is missing! They think you did it!"
translation.ja: “彼の失踪で君は疑われている”

translation.en: "Stop lying to me!"
translation.ja: “ウソをつくな”

translation.en: I yelled at him like that. I pounded the thing.
translation.ja: 私は叫び 机をたたいた

translation.en: And he got very sheepish, and he said, "Do you have anything to drink here?"
translation.ja: 彼はおどおどして“酒はあるか”と言った

translation.en: I poured a little vino for me, a little bit for Gacy, little bit for Stevens.
translation.ja: 私とリロイとゲイシーにワインをついだ

translation.en: We each drank a shot of it. And Gacy said, "Fill up my cup."
translation.ja: １杯飲むと ゲイシーがもう１杯欲しがった

translation.en: And I filled his cup up,
translation.ja: だから ついだ

translation.en: and he just chugged it down, chugged it down.
translation.ja: すると一気に飲み干し

translation.en: He looks at the picture of Robbie Piest, he goes, um… [clicks tongue]
translation.ja: ピーストの写真を見て言った

translation.en: "This boy is dead." Just like that.
translation.ja: “この子は死んでいる”

translation.en: My heart… My heart start… boom-boom… started pounding.
translation.ja: 私の心臓がドキドキし始めて

translation.en: It was just… I'm like, "What? What am I getting into here?"
translation.ja: “一体 何の話だ？”と思った

translation.en: Then he says… And Leroy and I are just sitting here watching him, and he goes,
translation.ja: 私とリロイが見ていると彼は言った

translation.en: "I've been a judge, jury, and executioner of many, many people."
translation.ja: “私は人々の裁判官で陪審員で執行人だった”

translation.en: Now I wanna be my own judge, jury, and executioner." "I wanna tell you everything that happened."
translation.ja: “今度は自分を裁き全てを話したい”

translation.en: [Amirante] I aged many, many years during that night, uh,
translation.ja: その夜 私は弁護士としても人としても

translation.en: both as a lawyer, uh, and as a person.
translation.ja: 何年も年を取った

translation.en: It was one of the scariest nights of my life.
translation.ja: 人生で一番 怖い夜だった

translation.en: My heart was pounding out of my chest the rest of the night,
translation.ja: 夜じゅう心臓がドキドキして

translation.en: s-smoking one cigarette after another one.
translation.ja: タバコを次から次へと吸った

translation.en: Leroy was smoking. He turned… He… he lit his cigarettes backwards. The filter was on the wrong end.
translation.ja: リロイは間違ってタバコのフィルター側に火をつけた

translation.en: And after he told us all this…
translation.ja: ゲイシーは全てを話すと

translation.en: he, um… he fell asleep.
translation.ja: 眠った

translation.en: [Gacy] I don't remember exactly what happened.
translation.ja: 詳細は覚えていない

translation.en: I can remember I went to Sam's office, but I did not go to Sam's office to tell him all that shit.
translation.ja: サムの事務所には行ったがそんな話はしていない

translation.en: Evidently, when I got there…
translation.ja: 事務所に着いて

translation.en: something else took over and some other conversation come up.
translation.ja: 別の人と別の話をした

translation.en: It was a horrible, professional, ethical spot for me as a young lawyer.
translation.ja: 30歳の若手弁護士の私にとって

translation.en: I was 30 years old.
translation.ja: 倫理的な事件だ

translation.en: And, uh, Leroy, you know, we had to figure…
translation.ja: 私とリロイは彼を精神科病院に入院させて

translation.en: The best thing to do is get him to a psychiatrist, have him committed,
translation.ja: 私とリロイは彼を精神科病院に入院させて どうするか決めることにした

translation.en: and then figure out what to do with this guy.
translation.ja: どうするか決めることにした

translation.en: So we set up an appointment
translation.ja: 夜のうちに精神科医を見つけ

translation.en: for, like, eight o'cl… eight, nine o'clock in the morning
translation.ja: 夜のうちに精神科医を見つけ 翌日の８時か９時に予約を取った

translation.en: with the psychiatrist we found during the night.
translation.ja: 翌日の８時か９時に予約を取った

translation.en: [Albrecht] My partner and I started that night
translation.ja: その夜 私は同僚と

translation.en: at Gacy's attorney, Sam Amirante's, office in Park Ridge, downtown Park Ridge.
translation.ja: ゲイシーの弁護士であるサムの事務所へ行った

translation.en: So just as I got to the building,
translation.ja: ビルに到着すると

translation.en: Sam Amirante and his other attorney, Leroy Stevens, were coming out of his office
translation.ja: 弁護士のサムとリロイが事務所から出てきた

translation.en: and into the vestibule, the whole building there, and they invited us in.
translation.ja: ホールまで来て私たちを部屋に入れた

translation.en: And they couldn't be nice enough to us. They cou…
translation.ja: 彼らは親切で “酒を飲む？”

translation.en: "You want a bottle of booze? Want anything to eat?" Um…
translation.ja: 彼らは親切で “酒を飲む？” “何か食べる？何でも買うよ”と言った

translation.en: "Whatever you want, we'll get for you. You can't let Gacy go."
translation.ja: “何か食べる？何でも買うよ”と言った そして“ゲイシーが逃げたら”

translation.en: "If he tries to leave,
translation.ja: そして“ゲイシーが逃げたら”

translation.en: you gotta shoot his tires out, and don't let him leave." "You can't let him leave."
translation.ja: “タイヤを撃って逃がさないで”と言った

translation.en: Finally, we said, "Sam, we're not gonna shoot somebody's tires out."
translation.ja: 私がサムに“タイヤは撃たない”

translation.en: "Unless, why? Why should we be taking this kind of activity?"
translation.ja: “なぜ撃つ必要がある？”と聞くと

translation.en: "Just do what you can." "I can't tell you now, but you… you can't let him go."
translation.ja: “今は言えないが逃がすな”と答えた

translation.en: [Amirante] About six in the morning, it started to get light.
translation.ja: ６時ごろ明るくなり始めた

translation.en: Gacy starts waking up. He goes, "What am I doing here?" You know…
translation.ja: ジョンは起きると“私はここで何を？”

translation.en: "What… I got things to do. I got places to go today. I'm… I'm really busy."
translation.ja: “やることがあって今日は忙しい”と言った

translation.en: I said, "John, you told me everything. You were here all night." "Leroy and I, you talked to us, you told us the whole thing."
translation.ja: “ジョン 君は私たちに昨夜 全て話した”と言うと

translation.en: "Well, I can't talk about that. I got places to go, things to do." "I'm outta here." Pew…
translation.ja: 彼は“それは話せないやることがある”と言い

translation.en: Takes off.
translation.ja: 去った
